ingredients.notes: Grain-derived. Distilled white vinegar is just pure acetic acid dissolved in water. It can be derived from petroleum products—kinda gross, huh? Although it may be chemically identical to plant-derived distilled white vinegar, the idea of feeding anyone something made in an oil refinery seems like a bad idea.
Please recommend a local organic supplier.

ingredients.supplier: Honestly, I am not sure where this was purchased. It is in a big bottle, so it likely came from a big box store. :(
ingredients.notes: Organic first cold-pressed extra virgin olive oil – dang, that’s a lot of words.
May have been stolen from Costco. Salt cannot be certified organic. Any salt that claims to be organic is a liar.
It is possible this is organic. Acquired by barter with a friend as a Ziploc bag of whole peppercorns.

label.notes: I had a coupon I could not refuse. The vinyl stickers easily peel away from glass, making reuse/recycling a breeze.

qr_label.notes: I have to be able to print these at home.

shrink_seal.notes: Yeah, it sucks, I know. I wanted to keep the product as fresh as possible.
